Now, for some tests that I wrote =
to test a Java version of the Unix touch tool, I generated the test file to=
 be touched using:

File testFile =3D File.createTempFile("utouch", ".txt")=
;
<do some testing stuff here>
testFile.delete();

This worked well for me =
on both Windows 2000, Cygwin running on Windows 2000 and Linux. I have ever=
y reason to believe that it will run on my new Mac OS X box, but time has n=
ot yet permitted me to validate this.

The advantage of this is that I have=
 no idea where the file is and have no need to know. The file gets created =
at the start of the test and deleted at the end of the test. I did it that =
way because I was new to Junit and few of my test files seemed similar enou=
gh to factor them out into the setUp or tearDown.
